subject: Baseball
lead_paragraph: Keith Foulke, whose toss to first base for the final out ended an 86-year World Series title drought for the Boston Red Sox, retired yesterday as he was about to begin a two-man competition with Joe Borowski to be Cleveland’s closer.
snippet: Keith Foulke, whose toss to first base for the final out ended an 86-year World Series title drought for the Boston Red Sox, retired yesterday as he was about to begin a two-man competition with Joe Borowski to be Cleveland’s closer.
